abstract: Israeli human rights group B'Tselem study finds attacks by Israel on homes in Gaza during 2014 war against Hamas that resulted in deaths of more than 600 Palestinians, most of them women, children and elderly, violated international law; study, first major one from an Israeli group, is released as International Criminal Court in The Hague begins inquiry into possible war crimes committed in Palestinian territories.
lead_paragraph: A human rights group said attacks in Gaza against Hamas last summer appeared in some cases to violate the provisions of international law, a report said.
snippet: A human rights group said attacks in Gaza against Hamas last summer appeared in some cases to violate the provisions of international law, a report said.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Israeli Group Says Military Attacks on Palestinian Homes Appeared to Violate Law
headline.print_headline: Israeli Group Says Military Attacks on Palestinian Homes Appeared to Violate Law
